title: Virtual Reality Exposure Therapy (VRET) Integration Program for Psychological Treatment Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational psychology knowledge and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: A program for current practitioners focusing on spreading treatment techniques using VR technology, with flexible learning environments via personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can explain VRE system operating procedures and technical limitations with 90% accuracy.
Learners can design exposure therapy scenarios for panic disorder/PTSD cases in a VR environment.
Learners achieve a simulation success rate of over 80% in therapeutic outcomes within a virtual environment resembling real clinical cases.
Learners develop customized educational materials combining treatment protocols with VR content reuse strategies.
Learners can integrate and operate client self-learning modules and therapist training systems.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
